content: side part wig modification to hallowig & flick cdd central double decrease slip 2 knitwise knit 1 psso co 143 curl stockinette st for 8 row flick k1p1k1p1 p3 k3 p3 k3… p3 p1k1p1k1 in other words k1p1k1p1 then k3p3 rib starting and ending with p3 then p1k1p1k1 yes there will be technically p4 at each end but just remember that one of those purls belongs to the edging eventually the edging will change and it won t look like a purl anymore and it will be much easier to distinguish do this for 4 or 5 row so the last row is a rs decrease on ws edge cdd in every k3 edge you should have 97 stitches if you don t you can adjust as needed in the next section to match the stitch pattern body establish pattern edge p1 k3 p1 k3… p1 edge for ~4 row the edging in the next section pulls a bit so having a few row of just k1p1 helps avoid it pulling up too much and having the flick be pointing up at your cheeks main body edge is now slip with yarn in back p1 slip with yarn in back p1 pattern is slip p1 slip p1 p1 k3 p1 k3 k3 p1 slip p1 slip p1 in other words edge k3p1 rib starting and ending with p1 edge you should have 97 stitches periodically hold up to face with flick at desired length and check the top edge do this until the top edge is at the top of your ear or wherever you want the side bangs to start form side bangs place markers @ 29 39 29 this adds up to 97 stitches markers will create 2 sides and one back i placed my bangs on the left side of my face so at the end of rs row you can mirror them by placing the increases at the beginning of the rs row instead rs m1p after last p1 between last p1 and edging this and all ws knit the knits purl the purls next rs m1k after last p1 between the 2 p1s you have before the edging repeat increases until new k3 p1 k3 p1 on that end so on that side you should have your regular 25 stitches of k3p1 then k3 p1 k3 p1 new then edging if you want wider bangs you can add more new stitches in pattern stop knitting the other side and back at this point you need to do some predicting you will need to stop knitting the non-bang side approximately 20 row before you finish the bang side so make note of how long and wide you want the bangs to be and how many row it will take you to decrease back down the models in this pattern have bangs that are 8 stitches wide i e 8 new stitches so 16 row then i knit for 7 row
